intro: Crepidifolium tenuicaule, commonly known as the slender-stemmed crepidifolium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, palmately lobed leaves. It produces delicate, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
